information.name: auditRecords
information.descriptionLong: REST endpoint to interact with Cumulocity auditRecords

endpoints.name: newAudit
endpoints.descriptionLong: Create a new audit record for a given action

powershell.description: Create an audit record for a custom managed object update
powershell.command: New-AuditRecord -Type "ManagedObject" -Time "0s" -Text "Managed Object updated: my_Prop: value" -Source $Device.id -Activity "Managed Object updated" -Severity "information"

go.description: Create an audit record for a custom managed object update
go.command: c8y auditRecords create --type "ManagedObject" --time "0s" --text "Managed Object updated: my_Prop: value" --source $Device.id --activity "Managed Object updated" --severity "information"

body.name: type
body.description: Identifies the type of this audit record.

body.name: time
body.description: Time of the audit record. Defaults to current timestamp.

body.name: text
body.description: Text description of the audit record.

body.name: source
body.description: An optional ManagedObject that the audit record originated from

body.name: activity
body.description: The activity that was carried out.

body.name: severity
body.description: The severity of action: critical, major, minor, warning or information.

body.name: user
body.description: The user responsible for the audited action.

body.name: application
body.description: The application used to carry out the audited action.

body.name: data
body.description: Additional properties of the audit record.

endpoints.name: getAuditRecordCollection
endpoints.descriptionLong: Audit records contain information about modifications to other Cumulocity entities. For example the audit records contain each operation state transition, so they can be used to check when an operation transitioned from PENDING -> EXECUTING -> SUCCESSFUL.

powershell.description: Get a list of audit records
Get a list of audit records related to a managed object
Get a list of audit records related to an operation

go.description: Get a list of audit records

queryParameters.name: source
queryParameters.description: Source Id or object containing an .id property of the element that should be detected. i.e. AlarmID, or Operation ID. Note: Only one source can be provided

queryParameters.name: dateFrom
queryParameters.description: Start date or date and time of audit record occurrence.

queryParameters.name: dateTo
queryParameters.description: End date or date and time of audit record occurrence.

queryParameters.name: revert
queryParameters.description: Return the newest instead of the oldest audit records. Must be used with dateFrom and dateTo parameters

endpoints.name: getAuditRecord
endpoints.descriptionLong: Get an audit record by id

powershell.description: Get an audit record by id
beforeEach: $Record = New-AuditRecord -Type "ManagedObject" -Time "0s" -Text "Managed Object updated: my_Prop: value" -Source $Device.id -Activity "Managed Object updated" -Severity "information"

go.description: Get an audit record by id

endpoints.name: deleteAuditRecordCollection
endpoints.description: Delete a collection of audit records
endpoints.descriptionLong: Important: This method has been deprecated and will be removed completely with the July 2020 release (10.6.6). With Cumulocity IoT >= 10.6.6 the deletion of audit logs will no longer be permitted. All DELETE requests to the audit API will return the error 405 Method not allowed. Note that retention rules still apply to audit logs and will delete audit log records older than the specified retention time.
